page.title: 05EASY ECONOMICS IN ASSYNT
page.content: Economics in Assynt is served by two establishments:- the Post Office and a branch of the Royal Bank of Scotland. The Post Office was set up in 1876, the first mails were telegraphed until 1918. Today, our daily mail does not arrive until teatime, arriving from Lairg rail station some 48 miles away! The Post Office offers all the usual facilities eg:- Savings Banks etc. Rural Post-buses serve the other communities from Lochinver. The Bank was established in 1905 & is the only Bank for many miles. With a staff of six, it looks after 600 local accounts & the needs of the Fishing Industry and the Tourists. The Bank here has a tiny sub-office in Drumbeg, open once a week. The Bank's services have this year been part-computerised to bring it into line with those in the towns & cities. Distance is a problem still!
